excerpt: Aerial tram ride with an on-board tour guide to a 2277-m. viewpoint & hiking trail.
detail_description: Ascend to the top of Whistlers Mountain on the Jasper SkyTram, the highest and longest aerial tramway in the Canadian Rockies. As you soar to an elevation of 2,263 meters (7,425 feet), breathtaking panoramas unfold before you. From craggy snow-capped peaks to pristine lakes like Pyramid and Patricia, the views are simply awe-inspiring.
name: Jasper SkyTram
address: Whistlers Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Jasper, an alpine town in Canadaâ€™s Alberta province, is the commercial centre of Jasper National Park. Amid the snow-capped Canadian Rockies, the park has glacier-fed lakes, forests and rivers. The Jasper SkyTram climbs to the summit of Whistlers Mountain, with views of downtown. The Jasper Yellowhead Museum and Archives presents exhibits on the fur trade, railway and early exploration of the park.
detail_description: Jasper, located in Alberta, Canada, is a bustling town at the heart of Jasper National Park. The park boasts stunning natural features such as glacier-fed lakes, lush forests, and winding rivers against the backdrop of the majestic Canadian Rockies. Visitors can take in panoramic views from the summit of Whistlers Mountain by riding the Jasper SkyTram. For history enthusiasts, the Jasper Yellowhead Museum and Archives offers insights into the area's past with exhibits on topics like fur trade and early exploration.
name: Jasper
address: Alberta T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Scenic lake with a mountain backdrop featuring a quiet beach, picnic area & small island.
detail_description: Pyramid Lake is a picturesque destination with a stunning mountainous backdrop, offering a serene beach, picnic spots, and a charming small island. As you glide across the calm waters of the lake, you may encounter wildlife such as loons, muskrats, and moose along the shore. The reflective surface creates an illusion of floating above the clouds amidst the breathtaking Rocky Mountains. Visitors can access the lake for activities like canoeing from various points including Pyramid Beach and other smaller access areas.
name: Pyramid Lake
address: Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Picturesque lake offering tranquil waters for kayaks & canoes, forested paths & mountain views.
detail_description: Nestled in Jasper National Park, Patricia Lake is a serene and picturesque destination offering a range of activities for nature enthusiasts. The 5km loop around the lake provides stunning views of meadows, valleys, and possibly wildlife sightings such as elk and moose. For more adventurous hikers, the trail to Geraldine Lakes offers options for both easy and challenging treks. Visitors can also enjoy stand-up paddleboarding on the tranquil waters or try yoga on a paddleboard for a unique experience.
name: Patricia Lake
address: Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Simple dorms & private rooms in a casual hostel offering a communal kitchen, a lounge & free Wi-Fi.
detail_description: Located in the heart of downtown Jasper, Jasper Downtown Hostel offers a range of accommodations including simple dorms, private rooms, and family rooms. The hostel features a communal kitchen, lounge with fireplace, outdoor BBQ area, and games room. It is within walking distance to shops, cafes, restaurants like the popular Jasper Brewing Company and the Friends of Jasper gift shop. Unlike other hostels in the national park operated by Hostelling International, this hostel is run by locals.
name: Jasper Downtown Hostel
address: 400 Patricia St, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: The Jasper Planetarium & dark sky telescope tours offer an unforgettable experience for stargazers. The Dark Sky Festival celebrates Jasper's Dark Sky Preserve designation with two weeks of programs, featuring talks by notable figures like Bill Nye and George Takei, as well as musical performances under the stars. Visitors can enjoy stargazing at Lake Annette and attend workshops on night sky photography.
name: The Jasper Planetarium & dark sky telescope tours
address: INSIDE the Fairmont hotel lobby, 1 Old Lodge Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Modern brewery offering housemade craft beers & elevated pub fare in a bright, stylish interior.
detail_description: Jasper Brewing Company is a modern brewery with a bright and stylish interior, offering housemade craft beers and elevated pub fare. It's a popular spot where visitors can settle down in front of an open fire, enjoy pub grub, watch big screen TV, and sip through a menu of craft beers.
name: Jasper Brewing Company
address: 624 Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Jasper is a charming town with plenty of attractions to offer. For breathtaking views, take a ride on the Jasper Tramway and enjoy the stunning scenery from Whistlers Mountain. The Jasper Station, built in 1925, is a heritage railway station that holds historical significance and offers insights into the town's past. Wildlife enthusiasts will appreciate the abundance of elk, deer, and Canadian geese in the area.
name: Jasper
address: 607 Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 1E0, Canada

excerpt: Quaint local museum showcasing the region's history through artifacts, photographs & displays.
detail_description: The Jasper-Yellowhead Museum & Archives is a charming local museum that offers a glimpse into the rich history of Jasper National Park and the Yellowhead Corridor. Through its extensive collection of artifacts, photographs, and displays, the museum preserves and shares the area's Indigenous heritage, fur trade legacy, and pioneer developments. With three distinct galleries showcasing historical exhibits and a showcase gallery featuring local art, visitors can immerse themselves in Jasper's early days and gain a deeper understanding of the community's origins.
name: Jasper-Yellowhead Museum & Archives
address: 400 Bonhomme St, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Valley of the Five Lakes offers a serene and peaceful environment for visitors to explore. The area is perfect for those seeking solitude, whether they choose to embark on a short three-mile hike or spend the entire day on the Whistlers Trail. The hiking is easy with minimal changes in elevation, making it accessible to all. A highlight of the experience is reaching the double red chairs and capturing a photo with one of the mirror-like lakes as a stunning backdrop.
name: Valley of the Five Lakes
address: Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

name: Jasper Raft Tours Ltd
address: Kiosk, 611 Patricia St Box 398, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Information center with maps & travel tips for Jasper National Park, plus a gift shop for souvenirs.
detail_description: Jasper Park Information Centre is a historic cobblestone-and-timber building that serves as the visitor center for Jasper National Park. Originally built in 1914 as the park administration building, it now offers maps, travel tips, and information on trails, backcountry hiking, wildlife viewing, and interpretive programs. Designed by architect A.M. Calderon, this National Historic Site is a prime example of rustic Canadian architecture. Visitors can also explore the gift shop for souvenirs.
name: Jasper Park Information Centre
address: 500 Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Warm-toned spot with wood panelling serving house-baked pastries, breakfast & coffee.
detail_description: Bear's Paw Bakery is a cozy spot in Jasper, offering a warm atmosphere with wood paneling and serving up delicious house-baked pastries, breakfast items, and coffee. It's a local favorite and popular among visitors as well. The bakery offers an array of freshly baked goods including muffins, cookies, cakes, artisanal breads, sandwiches, and wraps. While it has limited seating inside, it's worth stopping by for a delightful breakfast or lunch experience.
name: Bear's Paw Bakery
address: 4 Pyramid Lake Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Upscale, rustic retreat offering rooms, cabins & suites, plus a spa, a golf course & Italian dining.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Jasper National Park, Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge is a luxurious retreat that recently underwent a multi-million dollar renovation. Set on the picturesque Lac Beauvert, this upscale lodge offers a range of accommodation options including elegant rooms and suites in the main building, as well as historic log cabins dating back to the 1920s.
name: Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge
address: 1 Old Lodge Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 1E0, Canada

excerpt: Casual log cabins, many with kitchens & fireplaces, plus a hot tub & a kids' playground.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of nature, Alpine Village Jasper offers a delightful retreat with its charming log cabins that perfectly blend rustic charm and modern comforts. Spanning 11 acres alongside the picturesque Athabasca River, this resort has been welcoming guests for over 70 years. With a variety of cabin sizes accommodating between two to five guests, families can easily find their ideal space.
name: Alpine Village Jasper
address: Athabasca Rd #93A, Jasper, AB T0E 1E0, Canada

detail_description: Lake Annette and Lake Edith are beautiful kettle lakes that formed at the end of the ice age in the Athabasca valley. Fed by an underground river system from Medicine Lake, these blue-green colored lakes offer opportunities for canoeing, kayaking, and stand-up paddleboarding. The lakes are shallow and relatively warm, making them perfect for swimming on a hot day. Hiking trails like Bighorn Alley lead to the lakes, providing additional exploration options after enjoying the sandy beaches.
name: Lake Edith and Lake Annette
address: Lake Annette Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Jasper Rafting Adventures offers an exhilarating yet safe experience for those looking to explore the stunning Athabasca River. With a mix of class one and two rapids, this adventure is perfect for families, ensuring that even younger children can enjoy the thrill without worry. The friendly guides are not only enthusiastic but also knowledgeable about the local landscape, making your journey both fun and informative. Whether you're splashing through gentle waves or taking a refreshing dip in the chilly waters, every moment promises excitement.
name: Jasper Rafting Adventures
address: 618C Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Wood-fired & thick-crust pies, plus wings, pasta & mains, in casual digs with a rooftop patio.
detail_description: Jasper Pizza Place, known as JPP by locals, is a casual dining spot offering wood-fired thick-crust pizzas, wings, pasta, and other mains. The restaurant's rooftop patio is a popular feature among visitors. One of their standout dishes is the Canadian poutine with an Indian twist called Rogan Josh, featuring crispy shoestring fries, mozzarella cheese, squeaky curds, and cilantro.
name: Jasper Pizza Place
address: 402 Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Embark on a unique adventure with Jasper Motorcycle Tours, offering 1 to 3-hour sidecar tours through the stunning Canadian Rockies. Feel the wind in your hair as you visit popular attractions like Maligne Lake, Miette hot springs, Athabasca river and falls, Medicine Lake, or Mount Edith Cavell. If you're an experienced rider, opt for a Harley Davidson rental and explore at your own pace.
name: Jasper Motorcycle Tours
address: 610 Patricia St, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Old Fort Point Rd is a short drive from Jasper and offers stunning views of the Athabasca River. The summit provides a great spot to enjoy the scenery, but watch out for elk droppings as these gentle creatures roam the area. It's a popular spot for locals to hike and enjoy nature after work, making it an ideal destination for outdoor enthusiasts.
name: Old Fort Point Rd
address: Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Immerse yourself in the captivating world of Cree culture with Warrior Women in Jasper. Led by a knowledgeable mother-daughter duo, this experience offers engaging storytelling, drumming, and singing around a crackling fire. Gain insight into Indigenous traditions and wisdom through intimate drumming and singing performances during the weekly Fireside Chat. Additionally, join Matricia for an enlightening walk where she shares her knowledge of plants while offering thought-provoking reflections on settler viewpoints.
name: Warrior Women
address: 500 Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

name: Lake Edith
address: Lake Annette Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

name: Canadian Canyoning Ltd.
address: 707 A Geikie St, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Waterfall on the Athabasca River known for its large volume of water & pine-forest surrounds.
detail_description: Athabasca Falls, located on the upper Athabasca River just west of the Icefields Parkway, is a remarkable waterfall known for its powerful force and stunning beauty. While not the tallest in the Canadian Rockies at 23 meters, it impresses with its large volume of glacial water forced through a narrow gorge. The surrounding pine forests and mountains provide an iconic Canadian backdrop that can be admired from convenient viewpoints along the trail and a footbridge across the canyon.
name: Athabasca Falls
address: Improvement District No. 12, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: This scenic, 50-m. limestone canyon in Jasper National Park features waterfalls & more.
detail_description: Maligne Canyon, located in Jasper National Park, is a stunning 50-meter limestone canyon known for its waterfalls and captivating scenery. Hiking along the Maligne River offers picturesque views and photo opportunities, especially starting at the 6th bridge. Despite its name meaning 'malignant' or 'wicked,' the only wicked thing about this place is the awe-inspiring beauty it offers.
name: Maligne Canyon
address: Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Ski resort with runs on varied terrains, snowboarding & more, plus lessons & children's daycare.
detail_description: Marmot Basin is a charming ski resort nestled in the Canadian Rocky Mountains within Jasper National Park. With a history dating back almost 100 years, this destination offers diverse terrain for skiing and snowboarding enthusiasts. The resort features 91 runs serviced by seven lifts, including high-speed quads, ensuring an enjoyable experience for all visitors. Marmot Basin's season typically runs from early November to early May, providing ample time to enjoy its stunning views and snow-covered slopes.
name: Marmot Basin
address: 1 Marmot Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 1E0, Canada

detail_description: Mountain Galleries is a prominent art gallery established in 1992 by artist and filmmaker Wendy Wacko. It is one of the largest commercial galleries in Western Canada, with locations in Banff, Jasper, and Whistler. The collection features works by major and mid-career Canadian artists, showcasing paintings and sculptures that represent the beauty of the surrounding area.
name: Mountain Galleries
address: 1 Old Lodge Rd, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Our Native Land is a unique store in Jasper National Park that offers a wide selection of arts and crafts, making it a great place to find one-of-a-kind souvenirs. Visitors can explore real Canadian culture through indigenous carvings and products made from authentic animal fur. The store also features First Nations art and quill art, providing an opportunity to take home something truly special. While some visitors have had mixed experiences with the staff, many appreciate the fantastic service and friendly interactions.
name: Our Native Land
address: 601 Patricia St, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: The Jasper Art Gallery, located in the heart of Jasper, is a must-visit for art enthusiasts. Showcasing a diverse collection of artwork from both local and international artists, the gallery features an array of paintings, sculptures, and photographs. Visitors can immerse themselves in the talent of up-and-coming Canadian artists while enjoying a quiet and unique atmosphere away from the main strip. The friendly staff are always willing to engage in conversation about the art on display.
name: Jasper Art Gallery
address: 500 Robson St, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Raised in 2011, this 13.7-m. Haida totem pole was carved by Jaalen & Gwaai Edenshaw.
detail_description: The Two Brothers Totem Pole is a 13.7-meter tall Haida totem pole located across from the Jasper visitor center. Carved by Jaalen & Gwaai Edenshaw, it was raised in 2011 to replace the Raven totem pole that previously stood there. Painted in traditional Haida colors, it depicts the story of two brothers who journeyed from Haida Gwaii to the Rocky Mountains.
name: Two Brothers Totem Pole
address: 416 Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: Morro Peak is a relatively easy hike located about 15 km northeast of Jasper. The trail is well-marked and offers great views of the surrounding area. It's a moderate climb with easy switchbacks, providing stunning vistas of the entire valley and the river below. The descent can be technical but manageable. This classic Jasper hike takes around 1.5-2.5 hours to ascend and slightly less time to descend, making it a good early-season warm-up for longer hikes.
name: Morro Peak
address: Improvement District No. 12, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

excerpt: Popular site for sports, including soccer & baseball, plus a playground & mountain views.
detail_description: Centennial Park in Jasper is a nature lover's dream, offering stunning mountain views and serene lakes. The well-maintained trails make exploring enjoyable, with abundant wildlife adding to the magic. The park features sports facilities for soccer and baseball, as well as a playground for kids. Visitors can enjoy picnics at clean and conveniently located areas, while ample parking makes it convenient for all.
name: Centennial Park
address: 520 Turret St, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada

detail_description: The Valley of the Five Lakes Trail is a captivating loop that offers an enchanting blend of lush forests, open meadows, and stunning lakeside views. Spanning 2.8 miles (4.5 km) with an elevation gain of 505 feet (153.92 m), this well-marked trail features numbered posts to guide you through its scenic wonders.
name: Valley of the Five Lakes Trail
address: Jasper, AB T0E 1E0, Canada

name: Cubz Play CafÃ©
address: 618 Connaught Dr, Jasper, AB T0E 0A8, Canada
